rootCause: Unrecycled AWS access key, insider involvement suspected
impact: Compromise of 3.4 million user accounts, including emails and phone numbers; data sold on dark web for 10 ETH (~₹30 lakh)
description:
In August 2020, the hacker group 'John Wick' allegedly injected a backdoor into Paytm Mall's database, gaining unrestricted access. The breach was reported by Cyble in late August, but Paytm denied any compromise of sensitive data. In July 2022, Have I Been Pwned listed 3.4 million affected accounts, though Paytm claimed it was a false alert related to Firefox browser data. The incident highlighted vulnerabilities in payment platforms.

Key details:
- Actors: John Wick hacker group
- Targets: Paytm Mall database
- Motivation: Data theft for ransom/sale
- Consequence: Legal notice to Cyble, security review

sources.title: Paytm Mall 2020 Hack Reportedly Exposed 3.4 Million Users' Data: How to Check If You Were Affected | Technology News
Paytm Mall suffers massive data breach as hackers gain 'unrestricted access' into database: Report - Moneycontrol
3.4 million accounts were compromised during 2020 Mall ‘hack’; Paytm denies | Hindustan Times (HT Tech)

verificationStatus: Verified (disputed by Paytm, confirmed by independent sources)

attackMethod: Exploitation of unrecycled AWS access key
impact: Compromise of 35 million customer records with masked card data, emails, phone numbers; 100 million transaction metadata leaked
description:
In August 2020, Juspay, a payment processor for platforms like Amazon and Swiggy, suffered a breach via an unrecycled AWS key, exposing 35 million records. The data was sold on dark web forums. Juspay notified merchants but delayed public disclosure until January 2021, sparking criticism.

Key details:
- Actors: Unknown hackers
- Targets: Juspay payment metadata servers
- Motivation: Data theft for sale
- Consequence: RBI inquiry, enhanced security

sources.title: Juspay Data Breach - Tsaaro Consulting
Data from August Breach of Amazon Partner Juspay Dumped Online | Threatpost
Juspay data breach could have far-reaching consequences | CSO Online

attackMethod: SQL injection on unsecure SQL file
rootCause: Misconfigured database (15 GB SQL file exposed)
impact: Leak of 20 million user records, including emails, hashed passwords, phone numbers, addresses, DOB, IP addresses; sold on dark web for ₹30 lakh
description:
In October 2020, BigBasket's unsecure SQL file was exploited via SQL injection, leaking 20 million user records. The data was sold on dark web forums; leaked publicly in April 2021 by ShinyHunters. BigBasket filed a police complaint and assured no financial data was compromised.

Key details:
- Actors: ShinyHunters
- Targets: BigBasket user database
- Motivation: Data theft for sale
- Consequence: FIR filed, user password resets

sources.title: What happened in the BigBasket data breach? | Twingate
BigBasket confirms data breach of 2 crore BB users, here is what we know so far
Hacker leaks 20 million alleged BigBasket user records for free

impact: Exposure of 20 million user accounts (11 million emails, usernames, hashed passwords, join dates, login times); sold on dark web for ₹1.5 lakh
description:
In May 2020, Unacademy's user database was breached, exposing 20 million accounts. The data, including emails and hashed passwords, was sold on dark web forums. Unacademy confirmed 11 million affected but no financial data leaked.

Key details:
- Actors: Unknown hackers
- Targets: Unacademy user accounts
- Motivation: Data theft for sale
- Consequence: Password resets, security audit

sources.title: Millions of Unacademy user accounts exposed in data breach: Report
Hacker sells 22 million Unacademy user records after data breach
Unacademy Suffers a Data Breach; 22 Mn User Records for Sale on Dark Web

impact: Exposure of 7 million users' sensitive data, including Aadhaar scans, PAN, bank details, fingerprints, certificates
description:
In June 2020, a misconfigured AWS S3 bucket on CSC-BHIM exposed 7 million users' data, including Aadhaar scans and financial details. The site promoted BHIM app for merchants; fixed after vpnMentor alert to CERT-In.

Key details:
- Actors: Opportunistic exposure
- Targets: CSC-BHIM database
- Motivation: N/A (misconfiguration)
- Consequence: Bucket secured, NPCI denial of BHIM app breach

sources.title: CSC Bhim app data breach exposed payment, personal details of over 7 million Indians
Report: Indian e-Payments App Exposes Millions of Users in Massive Data Breach
Govt denies data breach of 7 million BHIM users, cybersecurity firm maintains its claim

impact: Shutdown of plants in India, US, UK, Brazil, Russia; disruption to Sputnik V vaccine production; data exfiltration
description:
In October 2020, Dr. Reddy's Labs suffered a ransomware attack, isolating data centers and shutting plants globally. The breach disrupted Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine trials; no ransom paid, data recovery ongoing.

Key details:
- Actors: Unknown (ransomware group)
- Targets: Global IT systems
- Motivation: Ransom/extortion
- Consequence: Operations restored in days, security overhaul

sources.title: Dr. Reddy's shuts 'key' plants worldwide after potential cyberattack hits COVID work | Fierce Pharma
Dr Reddy's confirms ransomware attack, says recovering & restoring data, ops - Times of India
India's Dr Reddy's isolates data center services after cyberattack | Reuters

rootCause: Misconfigured cloud server without password protection
impact: Exposure of millions of patient records, including COVID-19 test results, names, addresses, phone numbers, emails, payment details; accessible for a year
description:
In October 2020, Dr Lal PathLabs exposed millions of patient records on an unsecured AWS bucket for nearly a year. Data included booking details, test types, and COVID-19 results; fixed after TechCrunch alert.

Key details:
- Actors: Opportunistic exposure
- Targets: Patient database
- Motivation: N/A (misconfiguration)
- Consequence: Bucket secured, investigations, privacy concerns

sources.title: Dr Lal PathLabs leaks millions of patients' sensitive data as part of major data breach: Know details
Dr Lal PathLabs, one of India's largest blood test labs, exposed patient data | TechCrunch
Dr Lal PathLabs data leak: Fine up to Rs 5 crore can be imposed as millions of patients at risk - The420.in

rootCause: Insecure data storage, possible insider access
impact: Leak of 5 million customer and employee records, including names, addresses, policy details, emails, phone numbers, DOB, hashes
description:
In July 2020, Religare Health Insurance suffered a breach due to misconfiguration, leaking 5 million records. The data, including policy details and employee info, was sold on dark web by a South Korean actor.

Key details:
- Actors: South Korean threat actor
- Targets: Religare database
- Motivation: Data theft for sale
- Consequence: Cyble alert, investigations

sources.title: Religare Health Insurer Hacked: 5M+ Records Leaked
Data Breach at Health insurer Religare Health Insurance

impact: Email server shutdown, leak of 1.8 GB data (5% of total, including staff lists, passports, audits); no full data loss
description:
In July 2020, Maze ransomware hit NHAI's email server, encrypting data and leaking 1.8 GB (staff lists, passports, audits) to pressure ransom payment. NHAI shut down the server promptly, preventing major loss.

Key details:
- Actors: Maze ransomware operators
- Targets: NHAI email server
- Motivation: Ransom/extortion
- Consequence: Server isolated, leak site monitored

sources.title: Maze Ransomware Operators Allegedly Targeted National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) – Data Leak
Hackers post NHAI data online, say there’s more

impact: Tweets promoting Bitcoin donations to PM Relief Fund, brief misinformation spread
description:
In September 2020, the Twitter account for PM Modi's personal website was hacked by 'John Wick' group, posting Bitcoin donation tweets to PM Relief Fund. The account was secured within hours.

Key details:
- Actors: John Wick hacker group
- Targets: PM Modi's Twitter
- Motivation: Scam/promotion
- Consequence: Tweets deleted, account secured

sources.title: PM Narendra Modi’s Twitter account hacked by ‘John Wick’ | India News - The Indian Express
Crypto Scammers Hack Indian PM Narendra Modi’s Official Website Twitter Account

impact: Encryption of servers, ransom demand of $750,000; data leak of financial, HR, sales info
description:
In November 2020, Haldiram's servers were hit by ransomware, encrypting files and demanding $750,000. Hackers leaked 1.8 GB data, including financial and HR records.

Key details:
- Actors: Unknown ransomware group
- Targets: Haldiram's servers
- Motivation: Ransom
- Consequence: Operations disrupted, investigation

sources.title: Food major Haldiram's attacked by Ransomware, hackers demanded USD 7,50,000 for decryption | Noida News - Times of India

organization: Multiple Indian Power Sector Entities (Mumbai Power Grid)
impact: Disruption of Mumbai’s power grid and potential for major outages; uncovered as a China-linked cyber operation amid India-China border tension
description: In October 2020, the Mumbai power grid suffered a rare and widespread outage. Investigation later suggested persistent targeting by China-linked APT group 'RedEcho', as reported by Recorded Future and confirmed in CERT-In/DSCI studies. Although attribution remains indirect, the case is a milestone in the escalation of cyber-physical threats on India’s energy sector.

details.Targets: Power grid SCADA and IT networks in Mumbai and western India
details.Consequence: Prompted cyber risk assessment and disclosure of vulnerability in Indian power sector

sources.title: China-linked group targeted Indian power sector amidst border tensions
